item.title: Net::Domain::ES::ccTLD
item.description: As I’m rewriting the core of Planeta Linux (you can track progress here), I needed a reliable way to map a country TLD to its Spanish name. I headed to metaCPAN to see what was already built to do that and found out Locales::Country that looked awesome but didn’t work for me, code2country('ni') would return undef for me, plus the countries that were actually there had the encoding all fubar, so fuck it, drop it.
